page.title: 19St.MARY'S THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {ST.MARY'S CHURCH}is situated at the south west of Redbourn.It stands at the end of{CHURCH END}near the Hemel Hempstead Road.It is the{Parish Church of Redbourn and is probably the oldest building in the village.Parts of it are over{800}years old. The{CHURCH }of{ST.MARY'S}as we see it today was built in three periods of history. The Norman Church was built by { {RICHARD DE AUBENAY}or{DE ALBIUI } who was the second Norman abbot of {ST.ALBANS ABBEY}about 1100. The parts of the origanal Norman Church that can still be seen are the {TOWER}and the walls of the{NORTH {AISLE.} The Church has been through many centuries and through many tumultuous times but has remained almost unchanged since the{15th}century.
